Botox is a quick and easy way to rejuvenate your appearance. Botox aesthetic injections help the face look fuller and more youthful by smoothing fine lines and furrows in the face and neck to get the fresh look you’re after.

What are Botox treatments?

Smiling, smirking, frowning, and other expressions can etch wrinkles and lines into your face. Botox, and other wrinkle reducers such as Dysport® and Xeomin®, temporarily halt the muscle movements that cause dynamic wrinkles and lines to form on your face.

These injectables contain small amounts of the botulinum.T. They’ve been used by millions of people in the United States and around the world and are FDA, Eu and Israeli health administration-approved.

What areas can be treated with Botox?

Botox treatments relax the muscular movement of certain places in your face where wrinkles tend to form. These include:

  • Around the eyes, or the crow’s-feet
  • Forehead, especially between the eyebrows (11 wrinkles)
  • Cheeks
  • Lips

These injectables can also help reduce the appearance of a gummy smile and slim your jaw.

Who is a candidate for Botox treatments?

Although wrinkles are natural, they can prematurely age your image. If you’re a woman or man bothered by the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles, consider Botox to restore a more youthful look. Dr. Epstein will review your medical records and aesthetic goals and help you determine if Botox is right for you.

When will I see results from Botox treatments?

You typically start to notice the effects of Botox and other injectables within 4-7 days of treatment. Final and optimal results are usually noticeable after two to three weeks.

Results will last up to four months, averaging on 3 months. at which point you’ll need retreatment to maintain your new look. GIllies aesthetic offers annual Botox injection packages that reminds you when you’re due for your next treatment.

Treatment takes just 10-15 minutes and requires no downtime, so you can go back to your daily activities right away. You may experience minor side effects, such as slight bruising or swelling at the injection sites.

Results vary by patient and no results are guaranteed.
